intro: Pavetta sylvatica, commonly known as the rough pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Pavetta sylvatica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
